sub_topic: The construction of the Koch snowflake curve.
message_1: What is the perimeter of a Koch snowflake fractal after three iterations, if the initial line segment has a length of 10 cm?
message_2:
A Koch snowflake is a fractal that is formed by starting with an equilateral triangle and then recursively adding smaller equilateral triangles to its sides. After each iteration, the length of each side of the snowflake increases by a factor of 4/3.

After three iterations, the length of each side of the snowflake will be:

Initial length * (4/3)^3 = 10 * (4/3)^3 = 10 * (64/27) = 640/27 cm

Since the Koch snowflake is formed from an equilateral triangle, it has three sides. Therefore, the perimeter of the Koch snowflake after three iterations is:

Perimeter = 3 * (length of one side) = 3 * (640/27) = 1920/27 cm â‰ˆ 71.11 cm
